titleInfo.title: Community Federal Savings and Loan Association ribbon cutting ceremony, Nashville, Tennessee, 1962 February 28

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: Nashville Mayor Ben West shaking hands with Wilma Rudolph at the February 28th, 1962 ribbon cutting ceremony at the Community Federal Savings and Loan Association. Wilma Rudolph, a native of Clarksville, Tennessee, became the first American woman to win three gold medals in the Olympics Games. Rudolph was considered the fastest woman in the world in the 1960s and competed in two Olympic Games, in 1956 and in 1960. The business was located at 2430 Jefferson Street in Nashville, Tennessee. The 1963 Nashville City Directory lists C. A. Rawls, President; A. C. Galloway, Executive Vice-President; H. D. West, H. T. Martin and W. S. Davis, Vice-Presidents; J. D. Martin, Secretary; A. G. Swett, Treasurer; Inman E. Otey, Manager; Mrs. Carolyn F. Riley Cashier. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission. subject.topic: Community Federal Savings and Loan Association (Nashville, Tenn.)
